titles: An elegy on the death of His Sacred Majesty, King Charles the II of blessed memory.
publisher: Printed by J. Millet, for W. Thackeray, at the sign of the Angel in Duck-Lane,
notes: Verse: "Unwelcome news! White-Hall it's sable wears ..."
At end of text: "Entred according to order."
Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Charles --  II, --  King of England, 1630-1685 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
